page.title: 08VILLAGE HALL,Yeoford.
page.content: Yeoford{Village Hall}was built in 1936. The Village Hall is made out of wood. There is a stage which the school uses sometimes for plays. There are two toilets (Gents and Ladies), each one has two toilets, one sink, one mirror and some coat pegs. The whole hall measures 17.5 m x 7 m 46 cm. In the hall there is one fire blanket and one fire extinguisher. There are 3 gas heaters and one wind-up clock. There are 66 chairs, 1 stool and 6 benches. There are 3 doors but 2 are fire exits. There is 1 piano with a stool. The hall was renovated in 1984 and it had new floorboards and the main door was moved, the door of the toilets moved and some kitchen units put in the kitchen. The hall is used by the Playgroup on Wednesday mornings, the School, Gardening Club and Youth Club on Fridays.
